Entries.default: The return to your body feels like waking after a fitful, drunken sleep. The rocking of the ship sends pain jolting through your limbs. Crashing waves hammer inside your skull.

Edér watches over your body with a glazed look, taking long, even tokes from his pipe.

At the first movement of your chest, he starts. His gasp, mid-puff, sends him coughing and straining for breath.
"My lord, have you returned to us?"
Entries.female: "My lady, have you returned to us?"

Entries.default: "Alive."
"I'm in a lot of pain."
"Weak, but I'm sure it will pass."
"Alive's a big improvement."
"That might've been me. I've been slapping you a little harder each day, trying to wake you."
"Sure. You been out a long time."
"Given what you've suffered, that is no small accomplishment."
"Considering how long you've been unconscious, I fear that's to be expected."
"Most of it, I'm sure."
"I hate to cast a pall over your recovery, but I'm afraid I have some bad news for you."
"I know."
[Remain silent.]
"Misfortune's brewing topside! We- Magran's fires, the captain stirs!" An older man with ale-sour breath rubs his bloodshot eyes and stares at you.

"How could you know all that? You been faking on us?"

He pokes at your shoulder with one finger.
"My lord, you've barely moved in weeks. How-"
Entries.female: "My lady, you've barely moved in weeks. How-"

Entries.default:
"I know this is asking a lot, but you better arm yourself and get on deck. Should be some gear in there."

He indicates a nearby wardrobe.
"It would be wise to arm yourself first, my lord. You'll find equipment in the wardrobe next to me."
Entries.female: "It would be wise to arm yourself first, my lady. You'll find equipment in the wardrobe next to me."

Entries.default:
"I never dreamed it'd work."

Edér stares with disbelief at what would likely be his slapping hand, examining both sides. He shrugs.
"Well, you owe me."
"Naw, there's no way. You're awake! What are you doing awake?"
"How you feeling?"

"Engrim, the smell of drink on your breath could wake the very dead.

"Now, what's this about?"
"Pirates. They're demanding parley with ye, captain."
"How are you feeling?"
The voice echoes from inside the bust - the remains of the Steward of Caed Nua.
The voice echoes from inside the bust - the remains of the Steward of Caed Nua.
"Caed Nua has been destroyed. Eothas possessed the statue of Maros Nua and rose from the ground, consuming the souls of all nearby."
"I know not how, but it seems he has retained a piece of your soul. And proximity to it has brought you back."

"It is only by the exceptional strength of your soul that you survived.

"And even then, just barely."
"The further Eothas withdrew, the weaker you became. We chartered this ship and followed him to the Deadfire Archipelago."
"Focused. The universe never fails to find a purpose for me."
"Sure. I mean, someone has to be there for the gods to get mad at."
"Let us hope it does not always need to call you to the Beyond to reveal it."
"Being dead was a profound experience."
"Sure, everybody should try it once."
"And may it be many, many years before you repeat it."
"Who are you?"

"Me? You don't remember?"

Edér points at his face, which he seems to be arranging into his most recognizable expression. Receiving no response, he shrugs.
"I'm the captain of this boat. And I was real big back in Dyrwood. Had this keep called Caed Nua. I was famous."

"And I was what you'd call a Watcher. I'd go around talking to dead folks and creeping out just about everyone who saw."

He holds up his hands with fingers curled to mimic claws.
"You, you're just some farmer, likes to follow me around. Take most of the beating for me when we get attacked."
"Very funny."
"That doesn't sound right to me."
"Really? I thought it was the other way around."
"Don't worry, it'll all come back."
"Ah, see? You remember."
"If you say so."
"Well, maybe it was you who was going around being a creepy Watcher. I get mixed up easily."
"But that fortress was mine, I remember that."
"Well, if it doesn't, I still wouldn't mind you taking the hits for me when the fighting starts."
"Anyway, you didn't answer my question. How you feeling?"
